title: macOS/LWJGL3: Gdx net uses deprecated APIs
body:
#### Issue details
The [Lwjgl3Net](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backend-lwjgl3/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/lwjgl3/Lwjgl3Net.java) class uses [deprecated, macos-specific APIs](https://openjdk.java.net/jeps/272) which are scheduled for removal from the JDK. The `com.apple.*` packages were deprecated in Java 9, and as-of [Java 16](https://openjdk.java.net/jeps/396), the JDK will throw an `IllegalAccessError` when calling (if using default settings).

These APIs are scheduled to become completely unusable in [JDK17](https://openjdk.java.net/jeps/403).

While OpenJDK offers the AWT-based Desktop API to replace this functionality, it's not usable for the lwjgl3 backend on macos. Calling `Desktop.getDesktop()` is enough to initialize the AWT event thread and causes any lwjgl3-based application to instantly hang, The LWJGL project often suggests using the [awt headless property](https://github.com/LWJGL/lwjgl3/issues/306#issuecomment-300481571) to workaround this issue, but this is nonsensical for the Desktop API's usage.

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.10+

#### Stacktrace
```
java.lang.IllegalAccessError: class com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3Net (in unnamed module @0x1f3f4916) cannot access class com.apple.eio.FileManager (in module java.desktop) because module java.desktop does not export com.apple.eio to unnamed module @0x1f3f4916
```

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x] MacOS
